                            <gmd:role>

            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The Nova Scotia Automated Surface Water Quality Monitoring Network was established in 2002 to assess water quality in surface waters across the province at five stations. In 2019 the station list was modified to reduce overlap with Environment and Climate Change Canada surface water quality monitoring stations. The results are used to help manage water resources, determine baseline water quality in lakes and watercourses throughout the province, evaluate the impact of human activities on surface water, and assess long term trends in water quality.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>
            <gmd:credit gco:nilReason="missing"/>

Any conclusions drawn or decisions made, based on an interpretation of the data, are the sole responsibility of the user.                             <gmd:extentTypeCode>
                                <gco:Boolean>1</gco:Boolean>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-sfmj-kf56
notes: The Nova Scotia Automated Surface Water Quality Monitoring Network was established in 2002 to assess water quality in surface waters across the province at five stations. In 2019 the station list was modified to reduce overlap with Environment and Climate Change Canada surface water quality monitoring stations. The results are used to help manage water resources, determine baseline water quality in lakes and watercourses throughout the province, evaluate the impact of human activities on surface water, and assess long term trends in water quality.

notes_translated.en: The Nova Scotia Automated Surface Water Quality Monitoring Network was established in 2002 to assess water quality in surface waters across the province at five stations. In 2019 the station list was modified to reduce overlap with Environment and Climate Change Canada surface water quality monitoring stations. The results are used to help manage water resources, determine baseline water quality in lakes and watercourses throughout the province, evaluate the impact of human activities on surface water, and assess long term trends in water quality.
notes_translated.fr: Le réseau automatisé de surveillance de la qualité des eaux de surface de la Nouvelle-Écosse a été créé en 2002 pour évaluer la qualité de l'eau dans les eaux de surface de la province à cinq stations. En 2019, la liste des stations a été modifiée afin de réduire le chevauchement avec les stations de surveillance de la qualité des eaux de surface d'Environnement et Changement climatique Canada. Les résultats sont utilisés pour aider à gérer les ressources en eau, à déterminer la qualité de référence de l'eau dans les lacs et les cours d'eau de la province, à évaluer l'impact des activités humaines sur les eaux de surface et à évaluer les tendances à long terme en matière de qualité de l'eau.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.
